mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Original house constructed 1721-1760; partly destroyed by fire, 1893. In 1909, Lutyens constructed an addition around the original house, added a third a story and extended the length with both additional wings and pavilions. Gardens designed by Lutyens and Gertrude Jekyll. The house was allowed to decline after WWII; converted into flats in 1965. In 2003 the house was scheduled for sale. The house was briefly home to Frances Hodgson Burnett, the author of the Secret Garden, between 1898-1907. Burnett found the original 1721 walled garden and restored it, planting roses. She wrote several books in the garden. Lutyens and Jekyll kept Burnett's garden; destroyed in WWII with a victory garden; later restored. -- Wikipedia/ The Buildings of England: West Kent and the Weald [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
